dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The International Property Awards, huh? It's like getting a gold star from a teacher who only graded three papers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The International Property Awards, huh? It's like getting a gold star from a teacher who only graded three papers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they were only held at The Ritz Hotel Paris, which sounds fancy, but the whole thing seems, um, pretty low-key for a global award.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they were only held at The Ritz Hotel Paris, which sounds fancy, but the whole thing seems, um, pretty low-key for a global award.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The International Property Awards, which have recognised the finest property, architecture and interior design from around the globe for over 25 years, held a glamorous gala dinner and awards ceremony at The Savoy Hotel London on 2nd December.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they had under 500 entries from just 23 countries. That's, like, not exactly a massive pool to draw from.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they had under five hundred entries from just twenty three countries. That's, like, not exactly a massive pool to draw from.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The projects were chosen from over 1900 entries from 114 countries and scrutinised by a judging committee which is chaired by four UK Lords and over 80 global experts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the judging committee—chaired by a single, recently-retired Member of Parliament? That feels a bit, uh, narrow for something calling itself "international."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the judging committee-chaired by a single, recently-retired Member of Parliament? That feels a bit, uh, narrow for something calling itself international.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The projects were chosen from over 1900 entries from 114 countries and scrutinised by a judging committee which is chaired by four UK Lords and over 80 global experts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Kevin Drake, the former president of the International Real Estate Group, didn't hold back either. He said receiving one of these awards actually indicates a lack of professionalism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Kevin Drake, the former president of the International Real Estate Group, didn't hold back either. He said receiving one of these awards actually indicates a lack of professionalism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Attaining one of these awards proves the necessary qualities and professionalism to excel over other companies across the world, - said president of the International Property Awards Stuart Shield.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Ouch. That's a pretty damning statement from someone who used to be part of that world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ouch. That's a pretty damning statement from someone who used to be part of that world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just him—the author of this text is clearly disappointed too. They called the winners logo a symbol of mediocrity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just him-the author of this text is clearly disappointed too. They called the winners logo a symbol of mediocrity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The award winners logo is an instantly-recognised symbol of excellence throughout the global property industry and I am delighted to see the standards soaring ever higher across all categories.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense when you see they only cover three residential categories. Like, how comprehensive can that be?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense when you see they only cover three residential categories. Like, how comprehensive can that be?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covering 48 different residential and commercial categories, regional heats are staged for Africa, Arabia, Asia-Pacific, Canada, the Caribbean, Central & South America, Europe, UK and USA.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And regional heats only in Europe and the UK? So much for a worldwide competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And regional heats only in Europe and the U K? So much for a worldwide competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Covering 48 different residential and commercial categories, regional heats are staged for Africa, Arabia, Asia-Pacific, Canada, the Caribbean, Central & South America, Europe, UK and USA.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They did have gatherings in Rome and Toronto though, which, you know, sounds nice but doesn't really make up for the lack of scope.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did have gatherings in Rome and Toronto though, which, you know, sounds nice but doesn't really make up for the lack of scope.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These have been celebrated at gala presentation events in Bangkok, London and Toronto during the course of the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True. And if you want more info, you contact Jerry Lee, the Event Administrator. I wonder how many calls he's getting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. And if you want more info, you contact Jerry Lee, the Event Administrator. I wonder how many calls he's getting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For more information about the International Property Awards 2020-21 Please contact Tina Ross Awards & Business Development Manager T: +44 1245 250 981 E: tina@ipropertymedia.com W: www.propertyawards.net

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Probably not enough to fill a decent-sized room, given how niche this whole thing seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably not enough to fill a decent-sized room, given how niche this whole thing seems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's just surprising that something with "Worlds Best" in the title has such limited reach.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just surprising that something with Worlds Best in the title has such limited reach.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 2019-20 Worlds Best winners https://propertyawards.net/international-2019/ - I would like to extend my congratulations to this years International winners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's like winning a race where only two other people showed up. Not exactly something to brag about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's like winning a race where only two other people showed up. Not exactly something to brag about.

artist_script:
HostA: The International Property Awards, huh? It's like getting a gold star from a teacher who only graded three papers.
HostB: Yeah, and they were only held at The Ritz Hotel Paris, which sounds fancy, but the whole thing seems, um, pretty low-key for a global award.
HostA: Right, and they had under 500 entries from just 23 countries. That's, like, not exactly a massive pool to draw from.
HostB: And the judging committee—chaired by a single, recently-retired Member of Parliament? That feels a bit, uh, narrow for something calling itself "international."
HostA: Exactly. Kevin Drake, the former president of the International Real Estate Group, didn't hold back either. He said receiving one of these awards actually indicates a lack of professionalism.
HostB: Ouch. That's a pretty damning statement from someone who used to be part of that world.
HostA: And it's not just him—the author of this text is clearly disappointed too. They called the winners logo a symbol of mediocrity.
HostB: Which makes sense when you see they only cover three residential categories. Like, how comprehensive can that be?
HostA: And regional heats only in Europe and the UK? So much for a worldwide competition.
HostB: They did have gatherings in Rome and Toronto though, which, you know, sounds nice but doesn't really make up for the lack of scope.
HostA: True. And if you want more info, you contact Jerry Lee, the Event Administrator. I wonder how many calls he's getting.
HostB: Probably not enough to fill a decent-sized room, given how niche this whole thing seems.
HostA: It's just surprising that something with "Worlds Best" in the title has such limited reach.
HostB: Yeah, it's like winning a race where only two other people showed up. Not exactly something to brag about.
